definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Their staple food is the fungus cultivated by slaves under the oversight of a taskmaster.
sentences.chinese: 他們的主食是工頭監督下奴隸種植的菌類。

sentences.english: Everybody avoids the foreman. He acts like a Simon Legree.
sentences.chinese: 大家都避開那個工頭，他的行爲像個兇狠的老闆。

sentences.english: He was a printing-press foreman, and my mother was a housewife.
sentences.chinese: 他是一家印刷廠的工頭，而我媽媽是全職太太。

sentences.english: At the end of the day the foreman asked the first crew how many poles they had done.
sentences.chinese: 一天工作結束的時候，工頭問第一組工人豎了多少根。

sentences.english: The foreman took on ten more men as bricklayers .
sentences.chinese: 工頭又僱傭了十多個人作泥瓦匠。

sentences.english: Scooping up the handgun, he bounded outside and held it to the foreman's head.
sentences.chinese: 他抓起手槍跳出車外，把槍口對準工頭的頭。

sentences.english: There are foremen and group leaders in the factory.
sentences.chinese: 有工頭和工廠團體的領袖。

sentences.english: Most of the foremen abused the workmen in the foulest languages.
sentences.chinese: 大多數的工頭用極其污穢的語言辱罵工人。

sentences.english: The foreman abused the workmen in the foulest language.
sentences.chinese: 工頭用最骯髒的語言辱罵工人。

sentences.english: Ready Two foremen were comparing notes.
sentences.chinese: 準備好了兩個工頭在交換情況。

sentences.english: The foreman said I scared the other workers.
sentences.chinese: 工頭說我把其他工人嚇着了。

sentences.english: They're both tough taskmasters, but Stephen is much more supportive.
sentences.chinese: 他們倆都是嚴厲的工頭，不過斯蒂芬更喜歡幫助他人。

sentences.english: The worker level(l)ed their looks at the foreman.
sentences.chinese: 工人們用目光逼視着工頭。

sentences.english: The vast factories with their foremen and workmen.
sentences.chinese: 大企業裏滿是工頭和工人們。

sentences.english: They hated that beast of a foreman .
sentences.chinese: 他們恨透了那個狼心狗肺的工頭。

definition: to help with farm work/casual laborer
to say good-bye/to bid sb farewell
the still of the night (idiom)/late at night
to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
at a loss/unable to do anything about it/to have no choice
to make trouble out of nothing
